Predicted Values

Source: vignettes/predicted_values.Rmd
predicted_values.Rmd

This vignette is under construction!

library(flexFitR)
library(dplyr)
library(kableExtra)
library(ggpubr)
library(purrr)
data(dt_potato)
head(dt_potato) |> kable()
trial year loc DAP Plot Row Range gid Canopy GLI
HARS20_chips 2020 HARS 0 1 1 1 W17037-24 0.000 0.0000000
HARS20_chips 2020 HARS 29 1 1 1 W17037-24 0.000 0.0027216
HARS20_chips 2020 HARS 36 1 1 1 W17037-24 0.670 -0.0008966
HARS20_chips 2020 HARS 42 1 1 1 W17037-24 15.114 0.0322547
HARS20_chips 2020 HARS 56 1 1 1 W17037-24 75.424 0.2326896
HARS20_chips 2020 HARS 76 1 1 1 W17037-24 99.811 0.3345619

0. Model Fitting 

fn <- function(t, L, k, t0) L / (1 + exp(-k * (t - t0)))
mod_1 <- dt_potato |>
  modeler(
    x = DAP,
    y = Canopy,
    grp = Plot,
    fn = "fn",
    parameters = c(L = 100, k = 4, t0 = 40),
    subset = c(166, 40)
  )
mod_1
#> 
#> Call:
#> Canopy ~ fn(DAP, L, k, t0) 
#> 
#> Sum of Squares Error:
#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#>   23.19   26.73   30.28   30.28   33.83   37.38 
#> 
#> Optimization Results `head()`:
#>  uid    L     k   t0  sse
#>   40 99.8 0.199 47.7 37.4
#>  166 99.0 0.262 42.8 23.2
#> 
#> Metrics:
#>  Groups      Timing Convergence Iterations
#>       2 0.7907 secs        100%   729 (id)
plot(mod_1, id = c(166, 40))

1. Point Prediction 

predict(mod_1, x = 45, type = "point", id = 40)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 4
#>     uid x_new predicted.value std.error
#>   <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1    40    45            36.8      2.69
plot(mod_1, id = c(166, 40), type = 3) + color_palette(palette = "jco")

2. Area Under the Curve (AUC) Prediction 

predict(mod_1, x = c(0, 108), type = "auc", id = 40)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 5
#>     uid x_min x_max predicted.value std.error
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1    40     0   108           6019.      89.6

3. Function of the Parameters 

predict(mod_1, formula = ~ L / 100, id = 40)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 4
#>     uid formula predicted.value std.error
#>   <dbl> <chr>             <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1    40 L/100             0.998    0.0162

4. Inflection points (First Derivative) 

# First Derivative
plot(mod_1, id = c(166, 40), type = 5, color = "blue", add_ci = FALSE)

predict(mod_1, x = 45, type = "fd", id = 40)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 4
#>     uid x_new predicted.value std.error
#>   <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1    40    45            4.62     0.391
interval <- seq(0, 100, by = 0.1)
points_fd <- mod_1 |>
  predict(x = interval, type = "fd") |>
  summarise(x_max = x_new[max(predicted.value) == predicted.value], .by = uid)
points_fd
#> # A tibble: 2 × 2
#>     uid x_max
#>   <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1    40  47.7
#> 2   166  42.8

5. Inflection points (Second Derivative) 

# Second Derivative
plot(mod_1, id = c(166, 40), type = 6, color = "blue", add_ci = FALSE)

predict(mod_1, x = 45, type = "sd", id = 40)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 4
#>     uid x_new predicted.value std.error
#>   <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1    40    45           0.241    0.0550
points_sd <- mod_1 |>
  predict(x = interval, type = "sd") |>
  summarise(
    x_max = x_new[max(predicted.value) == predicted.value],
    x_min = x_new[min(predicted.value) == predicted.value],
    .by = uid
  )
points_sd
#> # A tibble: 2 × 3
#>     uid x_max x_min
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1    40  41.1  54.3
#> 2   166  37.8  47.9
